title: Make backlog distribution roll numbers open the Student Data Sheet

requirements.text: In the Dashboard > Subject Analysis tab, update the Backlog Distribution panel so that each displayed roll number is clickable and selecting it opens the full Student Data Sheet for that student (using the same behavior as selecting a roll number from the Subject Analysis failed-students dropdown).

quotes: make it same for the backlog distribution also when we click on the roll no the complete data sheet of student should appear

acceptanceCriteria: In Backlog Distribution, each roll number is rendered as an interactive control (e.g., button-like badge) with a clear hover/focus state.
Clicking a roll number sets the currently selected roll number in the dashboard state and displays the existing StudentDataSheetPanel populated with that student's record.
If a roll number from Backlog Distribution does not exist in the currently filtered semester/department dataset, the existing 'Student Not Found' state in StudentDataSheetPanel is shown.
This change does not break the existing SubjectAnalysisList failed-student selection behavior.

requirements.text: Add a callback interface between SemesterDashboardView and BacklogDistributionPanel (e.g., an onRollNumberSelect prop) so the Backlog Distribution panel can notify the dashboard of the clicked roll number without duplicating Student Data Sheet rendering logic inside BacklogDistributionPanel.

quotes: make it same for the backlog distribution also when we click on the roll no the complete data sheet of student should appear

acceptanceCriteria: BacklogDistributionPanel accepts an optional roll-number selection callback and invokes it with the clicked roll number string.
SemesterDashboardView passes its existing roll-number selection handler to BacklogDistributionPanel.
StudentDataSheetPanel remains rendered only by SemesterDashboardView (single place of truth for selection).

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing shadcn components instead).
Do not modify Internet Identity hooks or other files listed as immutable paths in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep all changes within the existing React + TypeScript + Tailwind structure; no new backend dependencies.
nonGoals: Adding new backend storage or APIs for student records (data continues to come from the uploaded Excel file).
Changing analytics calculations for backlog distribution or subject failures.
Adding new navigation routes or a separate dedicated page for the student data sheet.
